definitions.definition: To open the mouth widely and take a long, rather deep breath, often because one is tired or bored, and sometimes accompanied by pandiculation.
definitions.example: I could see my students yawning, so I knew the lesson was boring them.
Death yawned before us, and I hit the brakes.

definitions.definition: To open the mouth, or to gape, through surprise or bewilderment.
To be eager; to desire to swallow anything; to express desire by yawning.
The action of the verb yawn.

definitions.example: a yawning chasm;Â  the shark's yawning jaws
